intro: Tornabenea bischoffii, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with multiple branches arising from the base. Tornabenea bischoffii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
